In his eagerness to learn, Tom forgets to use the polite Chinese phrase ""请问"" (qǐngwèn) before asking the question. column1: Norm: When an equal, lower status, or unfamiliar person gives a direct command, it is acceptable to give a command without any politeness marker.,"Situation: At a construction site in China, the foreman, Mr. Li, is giving commands to the workers about the specific tasks they need to complete for the day. One of the workers, Yang, is new to the job and is not fully aware of the procedures. However, instead of politely asking for clarification, Yang raises his voice and gives a direct command to Mr. Li to explain the task again. This behavior is considered highly disrespectful and unacceptable in Chinese culture, especially when communicating with higher status individuals. Mr. Li feels offended and embarrassed in front of other workers, and he calmly reminds Yang that he should avoid being so direct and always use polite language in the workplace.",规范：当平辈、下级或陌生人直接下命令时，可以不使用任何礼貌语气词来回应。,情境：在中国的一个建筑工地，工头李先生正在向工人们发出他们当天需要完成的具体任务的命令。其中一名工人杨某是新手，对这些程序并不完全了解。然而，杨并没有客气地要求说明，而是提高了声音，直接命令李先生再次说明任务。这种行为在中国文化中被认为是非常不尊重和不可接受的，尤其是在与地位较高的人交流时。李先生在其他工人面前感到被冒犯和尴尬，他平静地提醒杨先生，在工作场所不要太直接，要用礼貌用语。,"Actor of the Norm:
